text:
Created attachment 28055
Test plan to reproduce issue

When using javascript in IfController, it leads to a OOM due to permgen Memory Leak.

A workaround is to use JEXL instead of Javascript:
${__jexl(${JMeterThread.last_sample_ok} == true)}

See mail from Stanton W Derry on JMeter user list date 8 december 2011.

Philippe
creator: p.mouawad@ubik-ingenierie.com

text:
Misconfiguration of Non Heap size, fixed by:
-XX:MaxPermSize=128m
creator: p.mouawad@ubik-ingenierie.com
sebb@apache.org
text:
Also from the message thread:

Another simpler option is to check:
"Interpret condition as Variable expression"

[this works because it bypasses running Javascript; JMeter interprets the condition directly]

(In reply to comment #0)
> Created attachment 28055 [details]
> Test plan to reproduce issue
> 
> A workaround is to use JEXL instead of Javascript:
> ${__jexl(${JMeterThread.last_sample_ok} == true)}

That will still will run Javascript on the result of the Jexl script, unless one also selects "Interpret condition as Variable expression".
